conclusion: The graph plots 1/v on the y-axis and x on the x-axis, showing a linear relationship.
Velocity v is related to position by v = ds/dt and 1/v = dt/ds.
The slope of the line is the rate of change of 1/v with respect to x.
The slope m can be expressed as d(1/v)/dx.
The slope m is positive, so d(1/v)/dx is positive, implying a is negative.
Since a is negative, the particle is undergoing deceleration.
